title: Step Rdm Integration Input
content:
RDM Integration Input is used in conjunction with other RDM steps for the synchronization of RDM data with external databases in a process spanning several plans. The step creates a shadow columnidand populates it with a
                unique process identifier which can be consumed by the RDM Reader step. Part of the configuration is specifying theProcess Name, which is the name of a DB synchronization defined underSynchronization > Databasein the RDM model project.

The step has one input endpoint, which should be connected to a data source with one row that contains parameters for the step. The columns in the parameters input source can have arbitrary names; they will be mapped to the
                configuration fields in the step:

Below is a sample parameters source:
